ModelLayer

Class Car

  • java.lang.Object
    • ModelLayer.Car

  • public class Car
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages a car's movement and calculates coordinates. Works together with the CarInGameDisplayLabel. Does not deal with the visual/on-screen representation of the car, which is the CarInGameDisplayLabel's job. The car's movement features:
    - Variable acceleration speeds, based on the current speed and direction (reverse or forward)
    - Variable speed limits, based on surface (road vs grass) and direction (reverse of forward)
    - Real speed (pixel/frame rate) to Virtual speed (0-100 mph scale) conversion.
    - Handling collisions (using the CollisionManager class)

    • Field Detail

      • _VirtualSpeedRatio

        private final float _VirtualSpeedRatio
        The ratio to be used when converting actual speed (pixel/coordinate change) to virtual speed (0-100mph).

      • _Speed

        private float _Speed
        The current speed represented as the number of pixel moves on screen between two frame changes. Example: 'speed = 3' means that the car needs to be moved 3 pixels horizontally or vertically from its current position if the car is rotated with 0, 90, 180, 270 angles. (if the car has a different angle, then trigonometric calculation applied to get the exact number)

      • _CurrentAngle

        private float _CurrentAngle
        The current rotation of the car, where 0 means facing North. The angle always matches one of the elements in the SharedResources.CAR_Simulated_Angle_Values array.

      • _ReverseMode

        private boolean _ReverseMode
        True if the car is in reverse mode. False if it is in forward or standing mode.

      • _OnGrass

        private boolean _OnGrass
        True if the car is currently on a grass surface (which impacts its speed limit).

      • _LastMoveHitTheWall

        private boolean _LastMoveHitTheWall
        True if the car hits the wall. This will result in the speed dropping to 0.

      • _LastMoveHitOtherCar

        private boolean _LastMoveHitOtherCar
        True if the car crashes with other car.

      • _CarImageFileIndex

        private int _CarImageFileIndex
        The currently displayed car image based on its current angle. This is an index number for the SharedResources.CAR_ImageFile_Angles array.

      • _CarDisplay

        private CarInGameDisplayLabel _CarDisplay
        The view layer object of the car representation. This JLabel displays the car's image.

      • _CurrentlyPressedKeys

        private java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> _CurrentlyPressedKeys
        A lists of currently pressed control keys. If a key is released, then it gets removed from the list. This can contain 0-4 values in total.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Car

        public Car(int _CarImageFileIndex)
        Manages a car's movement and calculates coordinates. Works together with the CarInGameDisplayLabel. Does not deal with the visual/on-screen representation of the car, which is the CarInGameDisplayLabel's job. The car's movement features:
        - Variable acceleration speeds, based on the current speed and direction (reverse or forward)
        - Variable speed limits, based on surface (road vs grass) and direction (reverse of forward)
        - Real speed (pixel/frame rate) to Virtual speed (0-100 mph scale) conversion.
        - Handling collisions (using the CollisionManager class)
        Parameters:
        _CarImageFileIndex - The starting angle of the car. This is an index number for the SharedResources.CAR_Simulated_Angle_Values array.

    • Method Detail

      • set_CurrentAngle

        public void set_CurrentAngle(float _CurrentAngle)
        Sets the angle of the car.
        Parameters:
        _CurrentAngle - The new angle. Must match with an element of the SharedResources.CAR_Simulated_Angle_Values array.

      • set_CarImageFileIndex

        public void set_CarImageFileIndex(int _CarImageFileIndex)
        Sets the currently used car image file.
        Parameters:
        _CarImageFileIndex - This is an index number of the SharedResources.CAR_Simulated_Angle_Values array.

      • LoadCarImages

        public java.awt.Image[] LoadCarImages()
        Retrieves the in-game images of a car for all the angles.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of images, where each image is the same car but with a rotated angle.

      • HandlePressedKey

        public void HandlePressedKey(int keyCode)
        Handles when a controlling key pressed during the game.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - The keycode of the pressed key.

      • HandleReleasedKey

        public void HandleReleasedKey(int keyCode)
        Handles the Key release event by removing the key from the list of currently pressed keys.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - The keycode of the released key.

      • HandleTurnButton

        private void HandleTurnButton(int key,
                              java.lang.Boolean isLeft)
        Turns the car if turning won't cause collision with other object or car.
        Parameters:
        key - The pressed turning control key's keycode.
        isLeft - True if the car needs to turn left (counter clockwise). False to turn right (clockwise).

      • WouldTurnCauseCollision

        private boolean WouldTurnCauseCollision(int supposedNewAngleIndex)
        Check if the turning of the car would cause collision with other objects or car. This does not turn the car, only checks.
        Parameters:
        supposedNewAngleIndex - This is an index number of the SharedResources.CAR_Simulated_Angle_Values array.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the car would collide using the new angle.

      • CalculateNextFrame

        public void CalculateNextFrame()
        Called with every new frame. Updates the speed based on the current speed, pressed buttons, collisions, terrain. Based on the updated speed calculates the new location and sends it back to the JLabel for refreshing.

      • CalculateNewLocation

        private void CalculateNewLocation()
        Calculates the new location for the car based on its current position, current speed and direction (angle)

      • CheckForCollisionAndMove

        private void CheckForCollisionAndMove(java.awt.Point nLocation)
        Checks for collisions based on the provided new location as a parameter. If no collision would occur on the new location, then moves the car to the location (by asking the JLabel). If collision would occur, then handles the situation based on the type of the collision:
        - If the car collides with grass, then this will be noted and speed changes might occur with the next frame.
        - If the car collides with other car, the GameEngine will be notified - If the car hits the edge of the map/tree, then zeroes down the speed and will not move the car.
        Parameters:
        nLocation - The new location where the car needs to be moved and collision needs to be checked.

      • GetCurrentAngleIndex

        public int GetCurrentAngleIndex()
        Returns the current angle represented as an index of the SharedResources.CAR_Simulated_Angle_Values array.
        Returns:
        The current angle represented as an index of the SharedResources.CAR_Simulated_Angle_Values array.

      • GetAngleIndexFromAngle

        private int GetAngleIndexFromAngle(float angle)
        Searches within the SharedResources.CAR_Simulated_Angle_Values.length array to find the angle in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle to be found in the array.
        Returns:
        The index number where the angle can be found in the array.

      • GetBoundsAsRectangle

        public java.awt.Rectangle GetBoundsAsRectangle()
        Retrieves the car's current location as a rectangle. This is based on the image file.
        Returns:
        Rectangle representing car's on-screen location. The size of the rectangle matches the image's size.

      • GetBoundsAsRectangle

        private java.awt.Rectangle GetBoundsAsRectangle(java.awt.Point startLocation)
        Retrieves a car's hypothetical location as a rectangle. This is done by creating a rectangle with the same size as the car's image and placing it into the location specified in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        startLocation - The top left coordinate for the rectangle.
        Returns:
        Returns a rectangle car sized rectangle at the startLocation point.

      • ReverseModeCheck

        private int ReverseModeCheck(int newSpeed)
        Inverts the newSpeed parameter's value to negative if the reverse mode is on.
        Parameters:
        newSpeed - The speed to check and change against reverse mode.
        Returns:
        Returns newSpeed if not in reverse mode. Returns (0-newSpeed) if reverse mode is true.

      • NewLocationByTrigonometric

        private java.awt.Point NewLocationByTrigonometric(java.awt.Point currentLoc)
        The Hypotenuse of the triangle (the speed) and the angle are known. Calculating the Opposite side of the triangle (X axis) by using Sine. Calculating the Adjacent side of the triangle (Y axis) by using Cosine
        Parameters:
        currentLoc - The location where the car would move from.
        Returns:
        Returns the new location based on the current speed and angle.

      • UpdateSpeed

        private void UpdateSpeed()
        Changes the current speed based on the currently pressed buttons.

      • Accelerate

        private void Accelerate(boolean useReverseSpeedLimit,
                        boolean useGrassSpeedLimit)
        Accelerate the car (changes speed) using variable rate acceleration. Checks for speed limit and slows down if overreached. Picks the slowest/lowest speed limit based the input parameters.
        Parameters:
        useReverseSpeedLimit - True to use a reverse (slower) speed limit. False to use standard speed limit.
        useGrassSpeedLimit - True to use a off-road (slower) speed limit. False to use standard speed limit.

      • Accelerate

        private void Accelerate()
        Accelerates a forwarding car using variable rate acceleration.

      • SlowDown

        private void SlowDown()
        Slows down the car by reducing the _Speed. If the _Speed drops below the threshold, the car gets stopped.

      • get_CarDisplay

        public CarInGameDisplayLabel get_CarDisplay()
        Retrieves the JLabel associated with this car object.
        Returns:
        The JLabel associated with this car object.

      • set_CarDisplay

        public void set_CarDisplay(CarInGameDisplayLabel _CarDisplay)
        Associates the JLabel with this car object. Also resets to the default values.
        Parameters:
        _CarDisplay - The JLabel to cooperate with.

      • GetVirtualSpeed

        public int GetVirtualSpeed()
        Returns the current speed of the car. This speed is not an actual speed, but rather a visualised speed on a scale.
        Returns:
        The current virtual speed, which is larger or equal to 0.

      • GetCrashedCarImage

        public java.awt.Image GetCrashedCarImage()
        Retrieves an image from disk representing a crashed car.
        Returns:
        Retrieves an image from disk representing a crashed car.
